projects.name: TusharBot_One (ROS2 Differential Drive Rover)
projects.description: Designed and built TusharBot_One, a modular differential-drive rover powered by ROS 2 Jazzy. The platform combines a Raspberry Pi 5, ESP32/Arduino motor controller, and a custom Li-ion power system to enable reliable experimentation in robotics. It supports teleoperation (joystick & keyboard), vision-based control (face/hand tracking), and is structured for easy extension into SLAM, and autonomous exploration.

projects.name: MAVRO ROS2 Challenge – Recruitment Project (Center of Excellence, 2025)
projects.description: Developed a ROS2-based robotics recruitment challenge under MAVRO – Center of Excellence at my college. Designed a Dockerized simulation environment where candidates performed SLAM, teleoperation, and autonomous navigation tasks using Nav2, Gazebo, and RViz. The challenge tested real-world robotics concepts such as mapping, localization, and multi-goal navigation, serving as a hands-on evaluation tool for MAVRO's 2025 recruitment process.

projects.name: NXP AIM 2025
projects.description: Selected as one of the Top 30 teams in Bangalore region out of 5500+ applicants nationwide for the NXP AIM 2025 – Artificial Intelligence in Mobility regional round held in Bangalore. The challenge involved designing and developing an autonomous robotic solution capable of performing complex navigation, perception, and AI tasks in a simulated warehouse environment.
